revised_title: Anatomy and Digestive System of the Tsetse-fly (Glossina palpalis)
tldr: The author describes the anatomy and digestive system of the tsetse-fly (Glossina palpalis), focusing on its importance for studying the evolution of trypanosomes in Sleeping Sickness and other tsetse-fly diseases. The article covers the nervous system, digestive tract, and other internal structures, providing a detailed description of their features and functions.
